etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French cinnamome (from Greek kinnamōmon), and Latin cinnamon (from Greek kinnamon), both from a Semitic language and perhaps based on Malay

definitions: an aromatic spice made from the peeled, dried, and rolled bark of a Southeast Asian tree
shortDefinitions: aromatic spice made from peeled, dried, and rolled bark of SE Asian tree

definitions: a reddish- or yellowish-brown color resembling that of cinnamon

examples.text: he wore a short-sleeved shirt and pale cinnamon slacks

shortDefinitions: yellowish-brown colour resembling that of cinnamon

notes.text: Genus Cinnamomum, family Lauraceae: several species, in particular C. zeylanicum, native to southern India and Sri Lanka
